snippet: As fans at the Italian Cup final seemed on the verge of boiling over, the police and the captain of one team approached the leader of a hard-core group of supporters in what was called a “grotesque” meeting.
abstract: Italian Interior Min Angelino Alfano denies that police sought permission from Gennaro de Tommaso, leader of hard-core supporters of soccer team Napoli, to start final of the prestigious Italian Cup; still, images captured on live television were damning, and de Tommaso is suspected of having ties to organized crime; many analysts say the Italian authorities have never really confronted problem of soccer hooliganism.
lead_paragraph: As fans at the Italian Cup final seemed on the verge of boiling over, the police and the captain of one team approached the leader of a hard-core group of supporters in what was called a “grotesque” meeting.

headline.main: Pride of Italy Takes a Dive as Soccer ‘Ultras’ Gain Control
headline.print_headline: Italian Soccer Takes a Dive as Hooligans Gain Control
